ai.summary: Stage 09 of the London to Walsingham route is a 36.8 km hard day hike. It combines a long distance with varied terrain and demands solid navigation and stamina. Suitable for experienced hikers prepared for a full-day effort.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surfaces including rural lanes, chalky tracks, and grassy paths with occasional road crossings. Expect uneven footing, long gentle climbs punctuated by short steep sections, and potential mud after rain. Weather in the UK can change quickly, so be prepared for varying conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day and start early. Check the forecast and daylight hours. Carry a map and compass (or offline GPS) and know how to use them. Bring enough water and high-energy food. Stay on marked paths and exercise caution at road crossings. Inform someone of your planned route and return time. In winter or wet conditions, wear waterproof footwear and layers. Carry a basic first aid kit and emergency shelter.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Layered clothing with a waterproof outer shell
Backpack with space for water and snacks
Mobile phone with offline maps and emergency numbers
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March to October)

seo.title: London to Walsingham Stage 09 – 36.8 km Hard Day Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Stage 09 of the London to Walsingham route covers 36.8 km with challenging terrain. Explore terrain, safety, gear, and best seasons for this UK long-distance hike.
seo.h1: London to Walsingham Stage 09 (36.8 km) – Hard Day Hike in the UK
